SENTENCE.STRING: ([German: Deutschland] [IPA: ˈdɔɪtʃlant]), officially the Federal Republic of Germany (Bundesrepublik Deutschland, [IPA: ˈbʊndəsrepubliːk ˈdɔɪtʃlant]), is a country in Central Europe.

is bordered to the north by the North Sea, Denmark, and the Baltic Sea, to the east by Poland and the Czech Republic, to the south by Austria and Switzerland, and to the west by France, Luxembourg, Belgium and the Netherlands.
borders are a portion of the Alps, the famous Rhine and Danube rivers, and the Black Forest.
capital is Berlin; many of the governmental institutions, ministries as well as embassies were moved to Berlin from Bonn (now Federal City of Bonn), the former capital of West Germany, in 1999.
is a democratic parliamentary federal republic, made up of 16 states ([German: Länder]), which in certain spheres act independently of the federation.
Historically consisting of several sovereign states with their own history, distinct German tribe dialects, culture and religious beliefs,
was unified as a nation state amidst the Franco-Prussian War in 1871.
is a member state of the United Nations, NATO, the G8 and the G4 nations, and
is a founding member of the European Union.
is the European Union's most populous and most economically powerful member state.
